Text Line: I watch where others avert their gaze. Beneath roots. Behind screams. There is a pattern, even in collapse. I¡¯ve seen it across centuries, carved into the bones of kings and insects alike. The world repeats itself ¡ª not in circles, but in spirals. Wider. Hungrier. You think this is the first time rot has come? No. This is the third spiral. The gods are not sleeping. They are waiting for it to reach them again.
First Answer Text Line: ¡· How many more spirals are left?
First Answer Result Command: tellraw @s "<Chernobog> Enough to bury what remains. Or birth something stranger."
Second Answer Text Line: ¡· And you? What do you wait for?
Second Answer Result Command: tellraw @s "<Chernobog> I wait for the lie to shatter ¡ª the one that says order is sacred."
